alert.note: Alert for Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:26PM CDT until July 28 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Tulsa. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and minor street flooding near Interstate 44 and Peoria in Tulsa due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly across other areas in the Tulsa metro once the storms reach these areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Bixby... Jenks... Jenks Riverside Airport... Tulsa International Airport... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
